meanings.definition: Formed an opinion before having all the facts
meanings.sent1: She prejudged the new student as unfriendly before even talking to him.
meanings.sent2: It is not fair to prejudge someone based on rumors.
meanings.sent3: The cat prejudged the vacuum cleaner as a monster and hid under the bed.
meanings.sent4: Don't prejudge a book by its cover; you might miss out on a great story.
meanings.sent5: Her tendency to prejudge often led to misunderstandings and missed opportunities.

meanings.sent1: The prejudged decision led to unintended consequences.
meanings.sent2: He regretted his prejudged assumptions about the outcome.
meanings.sent3: The prejudged cake turned out to be a delicious surprise.
meanings.sent4: Her prejudged attitude closed her off to new experiences.
meanings.sent5: The prejudged conclusion proved to be completely wrong.
